Howdy:

   I am running into a similar problem.  I have also tried to chang=
e
the includes in the file CVodesIntegrator.cpp to what is below but
with n=
o prevail.

   The (partial) problem lies in the fact that the sundials pac=
kage
(it's called ) have a totally different naming convention than what is=

anticipated in Cantera.  The includes in the CVodesIntegrator.cpp file
onl=
y unearths part of the problem.

   Further, look line 56 of the file /usr/=
include/nvector_serial.h,
the include file is actually pointing at the wron=
g place
("sundials_nvector.h").  What I cannot isolate, is whether the prob=
lem
is with Cantera, cvnodes, or both.

   Needless to say, I did not get a=
ny further, and I sincerely hope
that I am wrong.

Cheers, Ed.

--- In cant=
era@yahoogroups.com, "mlbeks1975" <mlbeks1975@...> wrote:
>
> I have been t=
rying the latest SUNDIALS release ( Release 2.2.0, March
> 2006 ) on SUSE L=
inux 10.0. Some of the header files are in different
> places from the thos=
e in Cantera, and some have been renamed. I already 
> see an #ifdef OLD_SU=
NDIALS, but it appears that some more finegrained
> version matching may be=
 needed.
> 
> To get my version working I have patched CVodesIntegrator.cpp=
 so it
> now reads:
> 
> // sundials includes
> #include <sundials/sundials=
_types.h>
> #include <sundials/sundials_math.h>
> #include <cvodes.h>
> #in=
clude <cvodes/cvodes_dense.h>
> #include <cvodes/cvodes_diag.h>
> #include =
<cvodes/cvodes_spgmr.h>
> #include <cvodes/cvodes_band.h>
> #include <nvect=
or_serial.h>
> 
> Can anyone confirm this?
>
